Philip attempts to bug American government communications. Meanwhile, Nina faces a potential polygraph test.
Philip and Elizabeth face painful turns in their missions. Meanwhile, Stan tries to access an American military program.
A botched mission impacts Philip and Elizabeth in different ways. Meanwhile, Stan's personal life unravels.
A vengeful old foe returns. Meanwhile, Stan makes an unexpected discovery.

Cold War drama series following two KGB agents posing as Americans in 1980s Washington DC. Phillip and Elizabeth Jennings seem like any other American married couple, but they are actually highly trained Soviet spies, who must kidnap a high-ranking defector and return him to Russia.

Cold War drama series following two KGB agents posing as Americans. Phillip and Elizabeth are set the seemingly impossible task of bugging Defense Secretary Caspar Weinberger's office before a crucial meeting in six days' time.

Cold War drama series following two KGB agents posing as Americans. Elizabeth's lover helps her and Phillip find the widow and baby of a dead agent to get them away from the FBI and back to the Soviet Union. Gabriel's replacement arrives with some important information.

Cold War drama series following two KGB agents posing as Americans. US President Ronald Reagan has been shot, but who is responsible? Elizabeth and Phillip are up against the clock - and the FBI - in trying to find out who is responsible and whether they need protecting.

Cold War drama series following two KGB agents posing as Americans. The FBI have new encryptions which are stopping the KGB getting in touch with an agent who has an extensive spying network within the US ballistic missile programme. Elizabeth and Phillip must try everything to get their hands on those codes, but Elizabeth is worried by Phil's closeness to Stan. Meanwhile Nina is doing her best to satisfy Stan's need for information.

Elizabeth and Phillip are kidnapped by someone who knows they are agents and are pushed to their physical and mental limits to reveal covert information. Have the FBI finally discovered their identity? In the absence of their parents, Paige and Henry get into a potentially dangerous situation. Beeman uses Nina to set up Vasili big time.

While on a mission to discredit an exiled Polish resistance leader in New York, Phillip is reunited with an old flame. The reunion leaves him questioning the nature of his relationship with Elizabeth. Meanwhile, Stan and Nina finally give in to temptation.

A German assassin has been ordered to kill American scientists involved in the ABM program. After the mission is aborted, Phillip and Elizabeth must stop him and prevent a possible war, without having any idea of his identity.

Phillip and Elizabeth shock their children when they announce they are separating. Meanwhile, Gaad orders an unauthorised mission to grab a KGB agent after Amador goes missing, with grisly consequences.
In the aftermath of Amador's murder, Gregory finds himself with limited options. As the FBI get closer and closer, Gregory makes his choice - much to Elizabeth's distress.

Amy and Ricky return home from their secret adventure. Meanwhile, Grace continues to shut out Adrian; Leo discusses the fire with Dylan's parents; and Anne learns how serious things are between Ashley and Toby.
I Do And I Don't: Amy is asked to mentor a new student, and Leo offers Ricky a full time job after he graduates.
Lies And Byes: Everybody has their own ideas on what kind of wedding should be thrown for Amy and Ricky.
Past History: At Ricky's first day of college he runs into an old friend, and Ben finds out he is off the hook for the school fire.
Grace convinces almost everyone to go to church, but it doesn't work out as planned.
Girlfriends: Amy encourages Kathy to make new friends, but she falls into the wrong crowd.
Amy is jealous of Ricky's new life at college.
Property Not For Sale: Ben and Amy have a heart to heart, about the status of their relationship.
Adrian and Omar consider living together. Elsewhere, Anne starts making plans for Amy's wedding.

Adrian grows despondent and refuses to leave her home, so Ben asks Amy to visit her. Meanwhile, Amy feels guilty that things are on such an upswing in her own life, and then they get even better when Ricky asks her and John to come live with him.

Ben and his dad make confessions to each other about their marriages. Elsewhere, Betty reaches out to Adrian; Ashley forges ahead with her trip; and Ricky is displeased that Amy hid the truth about their new living situation from Adrian.

Grace juggles three guys: her new secret love interest, her boyfriend and her ex-boyfriend. Meanwhile, Ben tells Adrian he wants to end their marriage; and Amy and Ricky hope to get their parents' blessing for their flourishing relationship.
Amy fears her son is ill, but Ricky disagrees and their argument intensifies at the hospital. Elsewhere, Ben continues to seek a way to end his marriage, while Adrian tests his feelings for her.
Adrian decides to empty out the nursery to help deal with her feelings, which causes Ben and Adrian to get into a huge fight.
Ricky has an interview with a local college but it doesn't go as planned, and Kathleen decides to play a prank on Grace.

Ricky gets rejected from a local college, so Amy tries to correct the situation, despite Ricky's request that she not get involved. Elsewhere, Ben believes that Adrian is moving on to another guy, and he isn't happy about it; and Grace adjusts to dating a college man.
Jack scrambles to find a date for the senior dance, and Amy tries to convince Ricky to take her to the dance.
Adrian changes her mind about Ben and sets her targets on someone else.
Amy is upset with Ricky over a voicemail, and Grace offers to set Adrian up with one of Daniel's friends.

In the third-season opener, Ben wonders if Adrian is lying about not being pregnant. Meanwhile, Ashley discusses birth control with her doctor; Jack learns that his parents are moving; and Amy is confused by Ben's behavior.

Amy gets into a music program in New York City, but she worries the faraway location will make it impossible for her to attend. Meanwhile, Jack searches for a new place to call home; Ashley helps Adrian cope with morning sickness; and Ricky confronts Adrian about the rumor that she's pregnant.

Amy gets support from her friends and family as she moves forward in pursuing a music program in New York City. Meanwhile, Ben doesn't let Amy in on his secret; Adrian struggles with making a decision about her pregnancy; and Leo fills Ruben in on Adrian's situation.
Goodbye Amy Juergens: Ricky moves into the Juergens' house to take care of John.

Amy runs into Bristol Palin in her dorm, and soon she realizes the music program is for teen moms. Elsewhere, Ruben is not happy with Adrian's choice about her pregnancy; Jack and Tom become roommates in the Bowman's guest house; and a rumor about Amy spreads through school while she's away.
News spreads about Adrian's choice regarding her pregnancy. However, Amy is still in the dark about the whole matter, thanks to Ben.
Ben travels to New York City to visit Amy and tell her about Adrian's pregnancy. Elsewhere, Ricky gets reacquainted with his mother.
Amy contacts Adrian and offers her support. Meanwhile, Ricky seeks assistance from Ruben; and George arranges a romantic rendezvous with Anne. Michael Imperioli guest stars as Adrian's ob-gyn.

Ruben asks Ricky to reestablish a friendship with Adrian, a move that displeases Ashley, who still has feelings for Ricky. Meanwhile, Ben directs his anger toward Ricky; and Jack intrudes on Grace's double date.
Ricky travels to New York City to see Amy, and his trip angers Ben and Adrian. Ben then accompanies Adrian when she gets a sonogram, and he entertains the idea of asking her to marry him.
The Big One: Amy struggles to balance her life as a new mom.
Grace is plagued with guilt. Meanwhile, Ben tries to figure out where he fits in Amy's life.
Par For The Course: Ricky intervenes when Grace isolates herself from her friends and family.
Ciao: George and Ashley attempt to help Amy with her hectic schedule.
Born Free: Amy tries to find a way to accompany Ben on his trip.
The Summer Of Our Discontent: Amy discovers her summer is going to be filled with working and school.
Summertime: George makes a big revelation to Anne.
Adrian tries to get George and Anne to reconcile, but her motives are selfish.
Hot Nuts: Adrian and Amy's fighting escalates and Ricky intervenes.
Knocked Up, Who's There?: Grace makes an impression on Adrian.

15-year-old Amy (Shailene Woodley) finds herself facing an unexpected pregnancy after a onetime hookup at band camp with Ricky, the school cad. Then she meets nice guy Ben, who's so enamored with her that he joins the band. Elsewhere, popular cheerleader Grace starts wearing an abstinence promise ring to show her commitment to her Christian values, causing much anxiety for her boyfriend, Jack.
Grace struggles to decide whether she should forgive Jack, and Ricky and Adrian try to figure out their relationship. Meanwhile, Amy experiences morning sickness, and Ben hears a rumor about her.

Ben continues to fall hard for Amy, and the two share their first kiss. Elsewhere, Amy tells her sister (but not her parents) about her pregnancy; Grace uses Ricky as a cover to sneak around with Jack; and a jealous Adrian feels like Ricky is just using her for sex.

Amy can't stand Ben's clingy behavior, especially in the face of her parents' increasingly strained relations with one another. Elsewhere, Ricky continues to play a part in Grace and Jack's ploy to see each another, but as things backfire, Jack seeks comfort from Adrian.

Ben and Amy are at odds about what to do: He's thinking marriage, while she's thinking about not having the baby. Elsewhere, Ashley pleads with her dad not to leave home and Grace learns that Jack did more than kiss Adrian.
After much delay, Amy tells her mother that she's pregnant. Meanwhile, on a day Amy doesn't show up at school, rumors circulate that she took off in order to "take care of" her problem.
Amy weighs her options regarding where she resides. Meanwhile, Ricky wrestles with taking responsibility for his actions.
Amy's grandma visits the family and offers to help out with Amy's situation. Elsewhere, Adrian makes sure her budding friendship with Grace is on display for all to see.

Amy and Ashley spend some time bonding with their dad, while Adrian locates her estranged father. Elsewhere, Tom has a little party for himself, complete with pizza---and a stripper; and Jason and Madison see Lauren kissing Ricky.
Amy finally makes a decision regarding school. Elsewhere, Adrian's mom suggests that she develop a relationship with her dad, and Henry and Alice take a new step in their relationship.
In the Season 24 premiere, Tyra Banks returns as host alongside returning judges Ashley Graham, Law Roach and Drew Elliott, who they welcome 26 aspiring models to compete for the title.
The top 15 are thrown immediately into the fire and expected to walk the lengths of Venice Beach Skate Park. Later, the models must master the beauty of pregnancy.
The models meet the fate of their image as each is given a signature trademark, but not all are pleased with their new look.
The top 13 are summoned to a screen test by Director Anthony Hemingway in order to compete for a walk-on role in one of his projects.
The contestants are challenged to break stereotypes of the modeling industry. With the help of beauty and social media guru Patrick Starr and supermodel Ashley Graham, the models must create vlogs.

The models take part in LA Pride week as they walk designer Christian Cowan's rainbow runway and vogue it out with RuPaul's Drag Race fan favorites Valentina, Katya and Manila in a glamorous queens vs. princesses photoshoot.

The models bare it all in a nude photoshoot unlike ever before. Later, the contestants create an anti-bullying PSA for the National Crime Prevention Council (NCPC), which triggers deep, dark secrets from each of the models' past.

The top seven transform into media mavens in order to compete in a digital campaign for supermodel Jourdan Dunn's clothing line, Londunn. Later, the models attempt to break the Internet as they pose alongside male models.
In the midst of movement and chaos, the models must master the art of motion whether it be on the ground or in a parachute.

The dream of being a PAPER Magazine cover girl soon becomes a nightmare for the top six as they're assigned personas out of their comfort zones. Later, the contestants attend a series of go-sees in an effort to win over real wor

In the Season 23 premiere, host Rita Ora welcomes 28 aspiring models to New York City, where they will be winnowed down to 14 contestants after embarking on their first challenge, go-sees with celebrity designers LaQuan Smith and Philipp Plein.
The top 14 contenders participate in runway boot camp with supermodel Stacey McKenzie. Later, the ladies partake in a heated discussion about race relations in the U.S.

The judges choose signature looks for each model, but some ladies aren't happy with their makeovers. Later, Ashley encourages the contestants to feel comfortable in their own skin as they get ready for a nude-photo shoot.
Hip-hop mogul DJ Khaled gives the models a lesson in social-media branding. Later, Instagram socialite Jasmine Sanders helps the ladies enhance their online profiles.
Law Roach discusses the importance of personal style with the ladies. Later, celebrity designer Nicola Formichetti introduces the models to avant-garde fashion.
Two models become romantically involved, but it could cost one of them the competition. Later, the ladies take on a body-in-motion challenge with Chanel Iman.
Stacey McKenzie and Beyoncé's choreographer, Chris Grant, challenge the models to create their own signature-dance routines for a block-party video shoot.
The models are invited to an exclusive party at luxury designer Philipp Plein's estate. Later, the ladies compete for the best couple shot as they pose for a luxurious-lifestyle shoot.
The previously-eliminated contestants return to compete against the top seven models in a fashion-music-video shoot featuring rapper French Montana.
The models must create a PSA in support of Amber Rose's initiative, SlutWalk. Later, the ladies portray iconic women in pop culture.
Season 22 begins with seven men and seven women in a third "Guys and Girls" edition.

Jonathan and Drew Scott from "Property Brothers" surprise the models by designing the cast house. Later, one of the contestants breaks down and decides to leave the competition, while the other participants pose for a semi-nude photo shoot in front of the public.
The models take part in a runway walk on shipping containers raised high above the ground. Later, Tyra guides the models in a photo shoot where they are bound together.
The models participate in an emotional photo shoot that honors war heroes. Meanwhile, some of the girls and guys struggle to accept their new looks, with one of them locking herself in a bathroom.
A huge argument occurs when romance blooms between some of the models. At the photo shoot, some of the guys and girls become insecure when they learn their photos won't be re-touched.
The stress of the competition gets to some of the models, which causes them to lose focus. At the photo shoot, the guys and girls are suspended in mid-air and made to look possessed.
The models struggle during an acting challenge. Later, the guys and gals are paired up for a sexy commercial at the beach, but jealousy runs rampant and some chemistry falls flat.
The models create a public service announcement in front of kids. At the photo shoot, the guys and girls pose as life-size dolls.
The models attend go-sees at modeling agencies and are paired with a previously eliminated contestant, who may earn the chance to come back in the competition.
The models shoot a music video for Tyra's new beauty line and former contestant Don Benjamin makes an appearance. At the photo shoot, the guys and gals must pose in mid-air.
Season 21 begins with 31 guys and girls competing to see who can take the best selfie. The number is reduced when the men and women square-off at a bowling alley.

The semi-finalists take part in a rigorous Los Angeles subway challenge to model outfits covering various seasons. Later, things get steamy during a nighttime photo shoot at a beach where the 14 finalists are chosen by Tyra and the judges.
The final 14 contestants move into a house. At the revealing photo shoot, the models are given only string to wear. Later, Tyra explains how the season's rain-themed introduction was put together.

A love triangle in the house causes some models to underperform at an optical illusion photo shoot. Later, during makeover day, one model unveils a never-before-seen look, while another suffers a breakdown.

Tyra teaches the models the three steps involved in making love to the camera to prepare them for a sexy black widow-themed photo shoot. Later, unexpected chemistry occurs between two models just before a challenge on stilts; and one model breaks a major house rule during a night of partying.

The models are tasked with mastering the ultimate hair whip for a wind-blown photo shoot. One girl is given a penalty and is allowed only five frames to capture the perfect image. Later, Nick Cannon gives the models a chance to be the face of his new ad campaign.
The models test their acting abilities when they compete for a walk-on role on a scripted TV series. Later, a frozen photo shoot turns icy after hurtful remarks are overheard in the house.

The models team up for a photo shoot challenge with judge Kelly Cutrone that results in two models recognizing the need to put their personal relationship on hold. Later, the models discover their common ancestry links when heritage comes into play as the styling concept for a futuristic sci-fi photo shoot that features a special guest posing as a robot.

Miss J gives some select models a private runway session to prepare them for Fashion Week, where they are challenged to book fashion shows with different designers, including Betsey Johnson. Later, a hair product photo shoot leads to harsh words and flaring tempers.
An eliminated model is brought back into the competition after fans cast votes via social media. Later, a challenge in a slaughterhouse; and an HIV/AIDS awareness photo shoot.

The competition heats up as America's Next Top Model returns, featuring male and female aspiring models competing for a career-launching prize package. The contestants participate in their first runway show and, during a photo shoot on the streets of Hollywood, the semi-finalists have to pose while the public votes on them. One model struggles with the decision of whether or not to stay in the competition, while judges Kelly Cutrone, Rob Evans and Tyra Banks use the social media scores from the photo shoot to aid them in choosing the competition?s top sixteen finalists. -- (C) The CW

During a photo shoot on the streets of Hollywood, the semi-finalists have to pose while the public votes on them. One model struggles with the decision of whether or not to stay in the competition, while judges Kelly Cutrone, Rob Evans and Tyra Banks use the social media scores from the photo shoot to aid them in choosing the competition?s top sixteen finalists. -- (C) The CW

The models have to compete in a vertical runway down the side of a building in the pouring rain. Then, the contestants are paired up and photographed in a mock-wedding photo shoot, which brings back painful memories for a recently divorced model. -- (C) The CW

The models get a lesson in chemistry as they pose alongside sexy supermodels Alessandra Ambrossio and Rob Evans in a risqué photo shoot. The contestants get make-overs, where, surprisingly, a few of the men have meltdowns over their new looks. -- (C) The CW

The models have their balance tested when they have to walk on a spinning runway during a turntable challenge judged by the editor-in-chief of Nylon Magazine, Marvin Scott Jarrett. Then, the contestants are styled in ?trailer-park chic? for a photo shoot. -- (C) The CW

Tensions run high when some of the models accuse another of abusing her power in the house. The guys and girls act as fashion correspondents in a challenge led by celebrity blogger Perez Hilton. Then, their acting skills are put to the test when they shoot a fragrance commercial with a role-reversing twist. -- (C) The CW

The guys play a prank on one of the girls, which throws her off her game. At a photo shoot where the models take on the nail art craze, things start to go badly when a few of the models who have become close get distracted after arguing. -- (C) The CW

After a challenge has the models exploring the streets of Los Angeles in their underwear, one of the guys can?t take the pressure and breaks down. At a photo shoot, where paint is thrown on the models, a few of the models are out of their element and fear it will show in their photos. -- (C) The CW

Two eliminated models get a chance to return; two overly confident competitors find it difficult to book a runway show; one girl gets distracted at the photo shoot due to her crush on one of the guys.

The models get ridiculous requests by a fake director (Reggie Watts). At a photo shoot that highlights flaws, one contestant can't focus because of a fight that occurred between the guys and gals in the house.
The 19th season begins with 13 college girls being cast to compete for the "Top Model" title.
The models pose as taxidermy. Later, the first girl is eliminated.
The models receive makeovers and then pose nude, but one girl refuses to take off her clothes.
Tyler Perry directs the girls as they interact with the public and wear outrageous costumes. Later, the models are transformed into zombies for an apocalyptic photo shoot.
Alicia Keys visits the girls and informs them they will model in a fashion show to raise money for a charity. At the photo shoot, the ladies pose as cheerleaders on a football field.
The models try to bring a video-game character to life when they visit a special-effects production house. At the photo shoot, the girls pose in Victorian fashions at a train museum.
The ladies visit Palm Springs and are challenged to take photos of themselves doing "random acts of modeling." Later, they pose for pictures at a low-rent motel.

The models are sent on go-sees to book jobs with designers. At the photo shoot, the girls pretend they are in prison and pose for mug shots. Later, the ladies are shocked to learn that one eliminated contestant is returning to the competition.

The models travel to Jamaica, where they participate in a dance challenge. At the photo shoot, the girls float on a river raft and must use their body language to express a love triangle that also includes Rob Evans and a local male model.
The girls meet designer Cedella Marley and wear bikinis created by her as they each are photographed riding on a dolphin. Later, the models pose as warrior princesses beneath a waterfall.

The first photo shoot has the women squaring off while posing as famous British and American public figures. New judge Kelly Cutrone and Nigel Barker join guest judge Kelly Osbourne and Tyra Banks on the judges' panel for the first elimination of the cycle.

Some of the models resist getting make-overs and a few of them are unhappy with their new looks. The women take part in an unusual photo shoot where they have to model as toddlers while posing with Kris Jenner as well as her daughters Kendall and Kylie. (guest star Kris Jenner)

The women have to create an ad campaign, which includes casting, wardrobe, providing props and hair and make-up. During the challenge, the models are mentored by Kelly Cutrone, who intimidates some of the women. At the photo shoot for the campaign, some of the models cannot handle the critique and start to break down. (Guest Judge Kat Deeley)

The American women start to break down while the British rally together. One of the women feels defeated and considers leaving the competition. At the challenge, the models are asked to create their own television commercial. During the photo shoot, the women model British couture hats while posing in vintage American cars. Kelly Cutrone and Nigel Barker join J. Alexander and Tyra Banks on the judges' panel for elimination.

The women head to Toronto for fashion week where they have to go on castings to book modeling jobs. Some of the models get discouraged when they don't book any runway shows. At the photo shoot, the women pose in foliage while being covered in maple syrup. (Guest Judge Beverly Johnson)
The women are mentored by "America's Next Top Model All-Star" winner Lisa D' Amato as they are divided into teams to create and record music videos. (Jessica Sutta and Nadine Coyle guest star)

The models are tasked with creating a PSA with some young girls for an anti-bullying campaign, where the winners of the challenge will receive a personal video message from a loved one. At a photo shoot, singer Estelle models with the women, who have to pose as art installations during a dinner party. (Estelle guest stars)

The models go to castings for the opportunity to open a fashion show for one of the Dorchester Collection Fashion Prize finalists with fashion's elite. At a photo shoot, a few of the women struggle while modeling heavy Hello Kitty couture gowns. (Georgina Chapman guest stars)

The final six women head to Macau, where they get a reading from an astrologer and are challenged with re-creating their auras through fashion and beauty. At the photo shoot, the models have to pose in exquisite silk gowns, while accessorized with silkworms crawling on their bodies. (Barney Cheng guest judges)

The models are challenged with having to learn a fight sequence and act in a scene with Nicholas Tse, international actor and pop star. The pressure is on as the women have to pose while harnessed atop a high rise tower in extreme rain and wind. (Nicholas Tse guest judges)

The 17th season begins with 14 former contestants who didn't win the "Top Model" title returning for another chance to claim the prize. At the first photo shoot, the models reenact memorable moments from previous cycles. Nicki Minaj is a guest judge.
The models receive makeovers and take part in a branding-theme photo shoot. Ashlee Simpson is a guest judge.
Kristin Cavallari gives the models tips on being a celebrity in Hollywood, and Mario Lopez tests their interviewing skills. At the photo shoot, the girls pose on stilts.
The models audition for a role on "CSI" in front of the show's creator, Anthony Zuiker. Meanwhile, one girl fears she will be eliminated due to a health scare.

The models wear fashions from the Kardashian Kollection in a runway challenge with Kim, Kourtney and Khloe Kardashian in attendance on the Santa Monica Pier. At the photo shoot, the girls are given guidance by La Toya Jackson.
The models play flag football for charity. At the photo shoot, the girls pose in pairs with model Coco Rocha.
The models create a signature fragrance and launch it at a public event while posing in a bathtub. At the photo shoot, the girls pose as reality stars. Kathy Griffin is a guest judge.
The models must write and sing a song about themselves. Rapper Game directs the ladies in music videos based on their songs.

The models travel to Greece, where they collaborate with designer Michael Cinco on runway gowns. At the photo shoot, one girl is conflicted when she is asked to pose in underwear. Photographer Nikos Papadopoulos is a guest judge.
The models explore Greece and its nightlife. At the photo shoot, Nigel Barker photographs the ladies re-creating moments from ancient Olympic sports.

The 16th season begins with 14 models moving into a Los Angeles penthouse and meeting model Erin Wasson before attempting to walk a runway in a large plastic bubble over a pool of water. At panel, one contestant is eliminated.
The 13 remaining models get acting tips and then perform on stage. At the photo shoot, the girls pose with live bees on them. Model Alek Wek is a guest judge.

The models receive makeovers and are styled by fashion expert Lori Goldstein. At the photo shoot, the girls wear couture dresses and are photographed in small groups. At panel, one person is eliminated.
The models get nervous when they learn that a runway challenge will use fire as an element. At the photo shoot, the girls work in pairs to film a retro-style coffee commercial.

The models work in teams to write, direct and perform in a cosmetics commercial, which leads one girl to read a competitor's diary. At the photo shoot, the girls pose with wild animals at the Los Angeles Zoo for a line of faux-fur clothes from guest judge Rachel Zoe.

Tyra gives the ladies tips on handling fame and the girls mingle with fans at a Century City mall. At the photo shoot, the models pose covered with mud and are divided into two groups---blondes and brunettes---for two separate pictures. Model Sonia Dara is a guest judge.
The girls pose for a breast-cancer-awareness ad campaign shot by Nigel Barker. Later, the models visit Universal Studios for a photo shoot with stylist Eric Daman.

The models pose at a landfill, where they wear eco-friendly couture outfits and are photographed by Nigel Barker. Also: Tyra talks to the girls about the importance of creating a portfolio. Designer Lana Marks is a guest judge.
Highlights of the season's first half are featured.

The models arrive in Marrakech, Morocco, and explore the city. At the photo shoot, one girl deals with body-image issues, while another one is chastised for trying to direct the shoot. Vogue Italia editor-in-chief Franca Sozzani is a guest judge.

The 15th cycle begins with 32 would-be models in Palm Springs, where they attempt to become one of the 14 finalists. The ladies attend a party hosted by designer Cynthia Rowley. The season's theme is high fashion.

The 14 models move into a Venice Beach house and take part in a photo shoot about teen bullying. Later, Demi Lovato visits the ladies on set to discuss her own experiences with bullying. Fashion designer Diane von Furstenberg is a guest judge.

The models receive makeovers and learn there is a surprise elimination upon getting their new looks. At the photo shoot, the ladies pose as fallen angels on the beach at Malibu. Fashion designer Patricia Field is a guest judge.
The models pose while riding a roller coaster and later take part in an underwater photo shoot. Fashion photographer Matthew Rolston is a guest judge.
Supermodel Karolina Kurkova visits the models to discuss healthy eating. At the photo shoot, the ladies pose with Mexican masked wrestlers.
The models are photographed on Rodeo Drive in Beverly Hills by fashion photographer Patrick Demarchelier.

The models visit the Grammy Museum and learn one of them will be chosen to be a Grammy Girl for the 2011 awards show. At the photo shoot, the ladies portray iconic fashion designers for photographer Francesco Carrozzini.
The models shoot their first commercial while wearing roller skates at the beach. At a runway challenge, the ladies wear items from designer Zac Posen's 2010 collection.
The final six models travel to Italy and pose for a group photo on a gondola in Venice. Later, they head to Milan and visit an Italian fashion house. Model Margherita Missoni is a guest judge.
The models attend go-sees in Milan. At the Lake Como photo shoot, the ladies pose as statues.

The 14th season begins in Los Angeles with 32 models vying for 13 spots. Their number is first cut to 20 and then to 12. The dozen ladies then travel to New York City and meet a 13th contestant before moving into a loft and undergoing makeovers. Perez Hilton appears.
The models pose nude at their first photo shoot. André Leon Talley, Vogue editor-at-large, joins the judges; and the first elimination occurs.
Former contestant Toccara Jones tests the contestants' fashion knowledge; the contestants take part in a dance-inspired photo shoot.
Brenda gets a new haircut to make her look younger. At the photo shoot, the models pose as vampires in a bloody bathtub. Back at the loft, Alasia and Anslee get into a screaming match.

The models pose with comedian Ross Mathews in a sexy photo contest to win diamond earrings. Later, the ladies dress in fake designer clothes and accessories for the main photo shoot. At panel, one person is eliminated.

The models learn how to dress for their individual body types. Later, they pose as various types of New York City women on a moving subway for the photo shoot. At panel, André Leon Talley harshly criticizes one contestant's outfit.

Guest judge Whitney Port visits the models as they prepare for a runway challenge in front of drag queens. At the photo shoot, the ladies pose in costumes made entirely of hair. At panel, Tyra reveals the foreign destination where the final six girls will compete.
The six remaining models travel to New Zealand and participate in go-sees with six designers. At the photo shoot, the girls all model the same dress and pose with a sheep.

The five remaining models participate in a five-frame photo shoot on the set of "The Lord of the Rings" in New Zealand and meet actress Sarah McLeod. Tyra is the photographer for the main photo shoot. At panel, one girl is eliminated.
The 14th season concludes with the four finalists being whittled down to two, who then shoot a cosmetics commercial and walk the runway in an Anna Sui fashion show. At panel, the winner is revealed.

The 13th edition of the series begins with 32 would-be models---all standing 5-foot-7 or under, a first for the competition. The number is quickly reduced to 14, with the remaining contestants receiving makeovers and moving into a plush Los Angeles home. The first photo shoot involves putting a twist on baby pictures. Chanel Iman appears as a guest judge.

Tyra teaches the ladies how to smile with their eyes. Later, they meet with model-agency head Sean Patterson, who eliminates one contestant. The photo shoot takes place at Santa Anita racetrack, where the models pose topless with a horse and a jockey. Lauren Conrad is a guest judge. A second person is eliminated at panel.

The 11 remaining models participate in their first runway show for designer Kevan Hall, after receiving tips from Miss J. Petite supermodel Jaime Rishar is a guest judge. At panel, one person is eliminated.
Tyra conducts the photo shoot and wraps the models in colorful fabrics. Petite model China Chow is a guest judge.

The nine remaining models are taught to dance without expressions on their faces by Benny Ninja. Later, a Cirque du Soleil-inspired photo shoot takes place in Las Vegas. Petite model Josie Maran is a guest judge.

The models navigate their way through Los Angeles as they attend go-see sessions with designers. The photo shoot has a martial-arts theme that requires the ladies to hang on wires. Model Jessica White is a guest judge.
Jessica Lowndes helps sharpen the models' interviewing skills. Later, the ladies must write their own scripts for a cosmetics commercial. Kim Kardashian is a guest judge.

The models move to Hawaii for the remainder of the competition. The ladies take surfing lessons to prepare for a photo shoot and they are each transformed into a biracial model. Petite model Kirsty Hume is a guest judge.

Supermodel Marisa Miller gives the five remaining ladies tips on modeling swimwear before they strike a pose while jumping into the ocean off of a rocky cliff. Later, the main photo shoot takes place underwater in the Pacific. At panel, one person is eliminated.
The final four models learn hip-hop hula moves to better channel Pele, the Hawaiian goddess of fire and volcanoes, for the photo shoot. Also: The ladies learn that two of them will be eliminated.

The 12th season begins in Las Vegas at Caesar's Palace with 34 would-be models participating in a photo shoot, after which Tyra selects the Top 13 contestants who then move into a loft in New York City. Next, the ladies take part in a fashion show and bring classic childhood games to life in a Central Park photo shoot.
The 12 remaining models receive makeovers and attend a photo shoot directed by Nigel Barker that uses light in creative ways. At panel, another contestant is eliminated.
The contestants walk the runway in a Jill Stuart fashion show, with the help of the advice of two models from previous cycles.

Cycle 3 contestant Toccara Jones hosts a slumber party for the ladies and offers tips on the modeling industry. Later, the contestants take part in a posing challenge and visit Ellis Island for a photo shoot inspired by images of immigrants from the early 1900s. At panel, one model is eliminated from the competition.

Beth Stern coaches the models during a photo challenge that requires them to strike the right facial expression to be placed on famous images of Tyra. At the photo shoot, each lady must emote a color that is painted on her face. Also: the house is divided over a contestant's surprising announcement at the previous panel that one model doesn't want to be in the competition and should be sent home.
Clay Aiken judges the models during an acting class, and Season 11 winner McKey helps the ladies prepare to shoot a cosmetics commercial.
Highlights from the first half of the season are featured.

Ciara surprises the models at their apartment and they join her on stage for a photo shoot. The models also play creative director for a photo challenge in which they style one another and direct a shoot. At panel, Tyra reveals the overseas location and reduces the seven ladies down to six.

The six remaining models arrive in São Paulo, Brazil, and test their navigation skills by participating in a scavenger hunt around the city. Later, the ladies learn a local fighting technique to use in a photo challenge. At the photo shoot, the gals pose as cultural icon Carmen Miranda.

The five remaining ladies race to impress five different designers at various modeling appointments while learning to navigate São Paulo, Brazil. Later, Nigel Barker directs a beach-themed photo shoot. At panel, the group is reduced to the final four.

The 11th season begins in Los Angeles with 30 would-be models being trimmed to 14 finalists and one of the contestants revealing that she is transgender. The 14 ladies move into a house and participate in their first photo shoot, which revolves around hot-button political issues. Later, the first person is eliminated.

The girls are ecstatic when Tyra announces it's time for makeovers, but of course tears are shed at the end results of the maneuver. Meanwhile, supermodel Susan Holmes stops by to guide the girls through a swimsuit-themed photo shoot.

The models' runway skills are put to the test when they must walk for the judges while wearing blindfolds. The winner of the challenge receives an advertorial in Seventeen magazine. Also, the ladies must pose with their eyes during the week's photo shoot.

Season 10 winner Whitney Thompson gives the models tips on shooting a cosmetics commercial.
The ladies travel to Europe and partake in a scavenger hunt, and then they model clothes in a storefront window.
The five remaining ladies travel by boat to various modeling appointments; Tyra directs the photo shoot; and one contestant screams at the judges during a critique.

The models get meaty, as they must pose with and wear meat for their photo shoot about the meatpacking industry. Meanwhile, Cycle 8 winner Jaslene Gonzalez makes an appearance that ends up with one contestant feeling hurt by something the top model says.
Under the leadership of Benny Ninja, the models participate in a posing challenge...on the streets of New York. As the competition intensifies, one girl begins to feel the pressure of it all.

It's go-sees time, and the models split into two groups for the adventure. Meanwhile, the photo shoot of the week entails posing in water while lying face down. Finally, Claire falls victim to an injury and Katarzyna is subjected to a second makeover.

The remaining models head off to their international destination, Rome, where they are faced with the challenging task of filming a commercial in Italian.

The ninth season begins with 33 new contestants embarking on a cruise to the Caribbean. The contestants then compete in a life-jacket runway walk and a photo shoot on the beach before the field gets narrowed down to 13. Season 8 winner Jaslene makes an appearance.

The models receive dramatic makeovers and one contestant is shocked when she is required to have all of her hair cut off. Later, the women take part in a runway challenge and a jungle-themed photo shoot. The judges send one model home.

The girls get a lesson on how to be a spokesperson and later must improvise a sales pitch and divide into groups to create public service announcements for charity. The winner of the challenge gets to participate in a makeup photo shoot directed by Mary J

A recap of the first half of the season includes Tyra discussing body image with the models and Bianca having confrontations with Chantal and Ebony. Also, Jenah chips her tooth; and Bianca runs into a glass door and hurts her lip.

The ladies are paid a surprise visit by none other than Tyra Banks herself, who gives them a lesson on how to pose for a moving camera. Meanwhile, as jealousy continues to fly throughout the house, the girls find out that they will participate in an Enriq

The ladies meet with student designers and must be their muses in creating a dress. The next day they must work the runway and give a speech about their creations. Meanwhile, the house drama heats up when one girl decides she's had enough bullying from th

The models arrive in Shanghai and move into a penthouse suite. They are given a lesson on body movement by a martial-arts expert and must perfect their poses while in midair on high wires. Later, the ladies shoot a cosmetics commercial.

The eighth season begins with 32 competitors taking part in a model boot camp. Next, they check into a Century City hotel where their number is reduced to 20 and then 13. The lucky 13 then move into a Hollywood Hills mansion and participate in a controversial photo shoot with Nigel Barker in which they must strike poses for political causes.

The 12 remaining models get tips on how to walk a runway and participate in a prom-themed fashion show. Later, the women pose as high-school clichés in a photo shoot, before their number is reduced to 11 by the judges.
The 11 models get makeovers at a Beverly Hills salon and then pose nude for a photo shoot. Also, a call from home devastates one contestant and a third model is eliminated.

Benny Ninja instructs the girls in a posing lesson, which leads to the models being tested in a challenge where they must duck, dive, and pose through a laser maze. Afterwards, the girls participate in a photo shoot showcasing a deathly crime scene.

The girls are in for some tough calls when they are broken up into teams and asked to design their own group displays at a department store - all while acting as their own mannequins. Drama unfolds after the challenge as one girl - who took advice from he

Twiggy tells the models how she got her nickname and the women are challenged to create nicknames for themselves. Later, the ladies use their new names at a Hollywood party attended by rapper 50 Cent and model Beverly Johnson, and two contestants end up in a swimming pool. At the photo shoot, the models must expose inner personalities.

Efren Ramirez and Tia Mowry give the models a crash course in character acting, prior to the ladies participating in an acting challenge. The photo shoot highlights scandalous moments from past seasons and features previous contestants, including Kim Stolz, Shannon Stewart, Rebecca Epley, Michelle Deighton, Bre Scullark, Joanie Dodd, Michelle Babin and Amanda Babin.

The models get a crash course in being on-air hosts and then test their new skills in Australia, where they conduct interviews using Aussie slang. Later, they shoot a commercial in the Outback and one contestant forgets her lines.
Highlights from the first half of the season include the models staging a mock fashion show, complete with the ladies impersonating the real judges.

The five remaining models visit top Australian designers and try to impress them. At the photo shoot, the ladies model swimsuits and must strike different poses for a men's magazine and for a women's magazine. Later, the judges send one contestant home.

All of the models get new haircuts, but not all of the women are pleased with the results. Next, Queen Latifah judges a makeup challenge. Later, the women participate in a photo shoot that requires them to wear outrageous wigs with moving parts. Back at the house, one model hogs the phone and refuses to let anyone else use it. Also, one model is eliminated from the competition.

Three models work a fashion show with past series participants; one of the gals gets sick and enters a hospital; the contestants strut across a catwalk suspended over water; a fourth model is eliminated. Dennis Quaid appears.
A contortionist teaches the models how to strike extreme poses, which they later use in a circus-themed photo shoot. Back at the house, gossip leaves one woman in tears.
Janice Dickinson shocks the models at a red-carpet challenge; at a photo shoot, the women pose as celebrity couples. Later, another model is eliminated from the competition.
Janice Dickinson shocks the models at a red-carpet challenge; at a photo shoot, the women pose as celebrity couples. Later, another model is eliminated from the competition.
A recap of the season's first six episodes includes previously unaired footage of a meltdown by Monique and an impersonation of Tyra Banks by Jaeda.

Professional volleyball player-model Gabrielle Reece teaches the gals the art of action modeling. Also, race driver Stanton Barrett runs the contestants through a fast-paced challenge. Later, the women take part in a photo shoot at a skydiving training facility.

The models take part in an acting challenge in which they must reveal something traumatic from their past. The one who expresses herself the best lands a role on a CW series. Also, Tyra announces the ladies are heading on an overseas trip. The photo shoot is a foreign-language commercial with a male model.

During an intense acting challenge, one model chastises the group while another reveals something traumatic in her past. Later, the models freak out when Tyra delivers news of their overseas trip and things heat up when the models shoot a sultry commercia
The models dance the flamenco for a photo shoot in Barcelona. Later, Tyra directs a shoot in which the women float in a pool of icy water. One contestant bows out early when hypothermia sets in.

The would-be models arrive in Pasadena. After a round of interviews, their number is cut from 32 to 20. The 13 finalists are chosen after a brief photo shoot, and they then move into a Los Angeles mansion together. At the next photo shoot, the contestants are shocked to learn that they will be photographed bald. The first of the 13 models is sent home.

The models get makeovers at a Beverly Hills salon and then are given a chance to win a $5000 shopping spree at a Los Angeles boutique. Later, the contestants pose with ice sculptures at the photo shoot.
The contestants model fashions that include live Madagascar hissing cockroaches. Later, the models are transformed into various fairy-tale characters.
One contestant stirs up controversy when she kisses a male model during a photo shoot. Also, Janice Dickinson and Lisa D'Amato give the models some tips.

The models receive lessons in improvisation at a comedy workshop and then put their new skills to use in a commercial. The winner gets a guest-starring role on "Veronica Mars." Later, some of the models appear in public-service announcements about HIV prevention. Nick Cannon makes a guest appearance.

The models are given tips on advanced runway techniques and are coached by two movement experts. Later, the women take part in a church fashion show. At the photo shoot, they model a line of shoes while krumping (a hip-hop dance) with Tommy the Clown.

The models are tested on their ability to handle harsh criticism and one model faces a surgical procedure. Tyra directs a black-and-white photo shoot where the contestants must appear tearful, yet beautiful, and two models receive visitors from home.

The models answer tough questions after being coached on how to handle an interview. Next, they travel to Thailand for a photo shoot that requires them to hang upside down while posing in a mermaid costume.

A look back at the first nine weeks features previously unaired footage, including Gina's biting habit and a prank on Jade. Also: The contestants attend a special dinner and react when Nnenna kisses a male model.
In Thailand, one model is rushed to the hospital while the others must learn a complicated Thai dance. Next, tempers flare when one contestant copies another's poses during a jungle photo shoot.
Thirty-six semifinalists arrive in Beverly Hills and introduce themselves to Tyra and J. Alexander, who eliminate 16 of them.
The finalists move into a Bel Air mansion and are driven in a stretch limousine. Robin Leach ("Lifestyles of the Rich and Famous") and photographer Mike Ruiz are guests.
After the models get makeovers, they are sent to Rodeo Drive on a shopping challenge. Hairstylist Louis Licari helps out with the new looks.
J. Alexander gives the models runway lessons, then they're challenged to walk on a moving catwalk. Designer Sue Wong and photographer Mike Rosenthal are guests.
Contestants point out each other's worst flaws, and Twiggy and Jay Manuel teach them to turn those imperfections into positive attributes. Janice Dickinson makes an appearance.
Supermodel Iman gives contestants beauty tips; comic Chris Spencer offers spokesperson tips; and Ryan Devlin ("Entertainment Tonight") interviews the models. Photographer Jason Wilheim also appears.
Contestants endure a grueling workout, meet with editors for ELLEgirl magazine and pose in the style of 1940s pin-up models with tight corsets in an automobile ad.

A recap of the first eight weeks of the season includes never-before-seen footage of the contestants, including what happens when a bird gets loose in the house and pranks that Coryn pulls on the other models. Also, Jayla is confronted about her negative and hurtful comments.

The models visit Eva Pigford, the show's 2004 winner, on a photo shoot and are challenged to appear angry while posing with stars from the series "Wildboyz." Later, one model is selected to appear as a guest star on "Veronica Mars."

Tension mounts as one model is accused of constantly talking about her competitors behind their backs; a photographer reveals candid pictures he took of the contestants that show them in an unflattering way; the gals pose in underwear inside a telephone booth. Guest judges include model Jenny Shimizu and photographers Mark Anderson and Nick Maroudias.
The contestants are suspended in air, posing as astrological signs, and one model is told she has the worst photo in series history. Tennis star Serena Williams makes a guest appearance.
The contestants get makeovers, and not all of them like their new looks. Also: the models must pose topless.
A runway-walking competition is judged by J. Alexander and talent scout Sandi Bass.
The contestants are suspended in air, posing as astrological signs, and one model is told she has the worst photo in series history. Tennis star Serena Williams makes a guest appearance.
One contestant catches impetigo, which makes her skin break out badly.
A photo shoot at a scenic location, where contestants are told to create their wardrobes using elements from nature.
The contestants work with an acting coach, then perform a scene with actor Boris Kodjoe. Also, a lingerie shoot with a top male model stresses some of the models out.
Jann Carl ("Entertainment Tonight") coaches the contestants on television interviews and they use what they learn to interview rapper Eve. One contestant gets bad news from home.
The girls go to South Africa and learn about the country's fashion and history.
The girls make their own outfits out of items they find in the nature surrounding the place of the shoot.

The models visit five top designers, but one contestant forgets her high-heeled shoes and must quickly buy a pair. The ladies pose as their alter egos at the photo shoot. At panel, the women must sell themselves to a fictitious fashion house.
A photo shoot with live tarantulas sends one model into hysterics; Tyra's mom, Carolyn London, makes a guest appearance.
The models meet Taye Diggs.
The contestants star in a fashion show, but one model's success overshadows the others, and two experience trouble on the runway. Also: the models pose topless for a jeans ad.
The models participate in a traditional Japanese tea ceremony. Later, the ladies don kimonos for the photo shoot and pose as geishas. At panel, one contestant is eliminated.
In Tokyo, the models learn about Japanese street fashions. The photo shoot is anime-themed and includes a motorcycle. At panel, one contestant is eliminated.

The models visit five top designers, but one contestant forgets her high-heeled shoes and must quickly buy a pair. The ladies pose as their alter egos at the photo shoot. At panel, the women must sell themselves to a fictitious fashion house.
A photo shoot with live tarantulas sends one model into hysterics; Tyra's mom, Carolyn London, makes a guest appearance.
The models meet Taye Diggs.
Highlights and previously unaired footage from the third season are presented. Included: one lady's admission to her mother that she was once a stripper; impersonations of Janice.

The second season opens with the 12 contestants meeting in Manhattan, walking a runway in front of firefighters and Marines and being asked to do a nude photo shoot with body paint and jewels. Tyra Banks is the host and J. Alexander is the runway trainer.

One contestant aces runway training, but her rivalry with another hopeful escalates into a house-wide fight. Model Maggie Rizer and runway trainer J. Alexander give tips on working the catwalk and designer Carmen Marc Valvo clothes the contestants in his fashions.

The contestants get extreme makeovers for a photo shoot in which they are suspended in mid-air nearly 100 feet off the ground. Guests include art director Jay Manuel, Sephora catalog beauty editor Julie Redfern, celebrity hair stylists Joel Warren and Edward Tricome, and photographer Richard Dean.
The models glam up for a photo shoot posing as legendary celebrities. Adrianne Curry offers advice.
The contestants meet with personality coach Sam Christiansen to learn charisma; are interrogated by Janice Dickinson; and face an underwater photo shoot.
A model's lips swell due to an allergy before a photo shoot, and the contestants undergo an acting exercise. Later, they're given a chance to show what they've learned.

The contestants learn the choreography to be in Tyra Banks' music video, and Wu Tang Clan members take some of them out on the town. Guests include video director Kennedy and choreographer Tony Michaels.
The competition stiffens in Milan, where the models are tested on their ability to perform under intense pressure and criticism. Guests include photographer Missimo Costoli and stylist Nolé Marin.
The second season's penultimate episode narrows the field to two.
A winner is chosen.
The finalists are weighed in, given a bikini wax and photographed in swimwear on the frigid rooftop of a skyscraper in winter.
Contestants face a catwalk competition and a racy men's magazine cover shoot. Runway trainer J. Alexander is a guest judge and some contestants have a night out with Wyclef Jean.
Contestants get radical makeovers including short haircuts and new hair colors, and are photographed with snakes. Jay Manuel and Derek Khan are guest judges.
A visit from a contestant's lesbian lover divides the loft, and a formerly confident participant loses focus. Commercial director Loren Haynes is this week's guest judge.
The other contestants think Elyse suffers from an eating disorder, and the gals get publicity training and are interviewed for television.
In Paris, the contestants face temptation, deal with cramped living space and make appointments with the city's industry gurus.

Jodie tries a new celebrity-dating app; Christine goes method for a new acting role; Beverley pulls out all of the stops to get her kids into a new prestigious preschool.
Beverley, Christine, and Jodie reminisce about the night they became best friends.
Christine's agent tells her that she is not booking acting work. Jodie convinces her to post a death rumor online.

Beverly and Christine have a day of unconventional relaxation, and Jodie substitute teaches an acting class for kids in the series premiere of this comedy about three former child stars who juggle reviving their careers with being busy wives and mothers.

Beverley and Christine recreate childhood rites of passage they missed, including a prom and a slumber party. Meanwhile, Jodie's self-proclaimed lack of sentimentality comes into question when she's reunited with a special stuffed toy from "Full House."

Jodie has a car-buying dilemma as she decides between her dream sports car and a practical minivan, and Christine's exclusive yoga class isn't as peaceful as she hoped in a sneak peek of this comedy series about three former child stars.

A video of Christine defending her right to breastfeed in public goes public, which leads her to become the face of a militant charitable organization; frugal Beverley takes a job at a high-end furniture store in order to get the employee discount.

The gals go camping for the first time after receiving an invite from their prankster pals, Heather and Nicholle Tom. However, this girls' bonding weekend takes a couple of surprising turns involving a stalker, confessions and the Cannes Film Festival.

Beverley tries to stay awake to attend a late-night party where she can network with industry folks; Christine attempts to revive her career by getting her estranged "Step by Step" cast members together for a TV show reboot.

Beverley hires an assistant for the first time; Jodie tries to cheer up a gloomy Christine by asking a stranger to pretend to be Christine's fan, but then Jodie feels like a third wheel when Christine and the faux fan genuinely bond.

In the Season 1 finale, Christine and Jodie attend a fan convention and end up in a compromising position at the afterparty. Meanwhile, Beverley shoots a DIY TV pilot with Soleil Moon Frye, another former child star, but they both vie for the spotlight.
